content:
Agriturismos can vary in price, but they're generally a great value for the price. Here's a rough idea of what you can expect to pay:

**Accommodation Prices:**

* Double room with breakfast: €60-€120 per night (around $67-$137 USD)
* Apartment or cottage with self-catering facilities: €80-€200 per night (around $90-$220 USD)
* Farmhouse suite or villa: €150-€300 per night (around $167-$330 USD)

**Meal Prices:**

* Breakfast: €5-€15 per person (around $5.50-$16.50 USD)
* Lunch: €15-€30 per person (around $16.50-$33 USD)
* Dinner: €25-€40 per person (around $27.50-$44 USD)

**Other Costs:**

* Wine tastings: €10-€30 per person (around $11-$33 USD)
* Cooking classes: €50-€100 per person (around $55-$110 USD)
* Bike rentals: €20-€50 per day (around $22-$55 USD)

**Tips and Discounts:**

* Many agriturismos offer discounts for longer stays, off-season bookings, or package deals.
* Consider booking a self-catering apartment or cottage to save on meal costs.
* Look for agriturismos that offer free breakfast, Wi-Fi, or other amenities.
* Be sure to ask about any additional fees, such as city taxes or cleaning fees.

**Budget-Friendly Options:**

* Look for agriturismos that offer dormitory-style accommodations or camping options for a lower price.
* Consider staying in a smaller town or rural area, where prices tend to be lower.
* Book during the off-season (April-May or September-October) for lower rates.
* Search for agriturismos that offer special promotions or discounts on their websites or social media.

To give you a better idea, here's an example of a budget-friendly agriturismo:

* Agriturismo La Canonica near San Gimignano:
	+ Double room with breakfast: €70 per night (around $77 USD)
	+ Dinner: €25 per person (around $27.50 USD)
	+ Wine tasting: €15 per person (around $16.50 USD)

Total cost for a 3-night stay: around €420 (around $460 USD)

Keep in mind that prices can vary depending on the time of year, location, and amenities. Be sure to research and compare prices to find the best fit for your budget.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any more questions.
